The schoole of pollicie: or The araignement of state-abuses Directing magistrates, adorning the court, and beautifying the whole common-wealth. Crosse, Henry.
[156] p.
By Valentine Sims for Nathanael Butter, dwelling in Paules Churchyard neere vnto Saint Austens gate, Printed at London : 1605.
An edition of: Crosse, Henry. Vertues common-wealth. With title page and dedication cancelled and cancel title page. Running title reads: Vertues common-wealth. Signatures: [A]² B-V⁴. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======
